com.nhn.android.maps

Class NMapOverlay

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.nhn.android.maps.NMapOverlay
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    NMapCalloutOverlay, NMapItemizedOverlay, NMapMyLocationOverlay, NMapPathDataOverlay, NMapRadiusSettingOverlay

    public abstract class NMapOverlay
extends java.lang.Object
    Base class representing an overlay which may be displayed on top of a map. To add an overlay, subclass this class, create an instance, and add it by NMapOverlayManager.

      • hasPathData

        public boolean hasPathData()
        Returns:
        true if this overlay has path data to be rendered using Canvas.drawPath() or drawCircle() etc.

      • isDrawnOnSnapshot

        public boolean isDrawnOnSnapshot()
        Returns:
        true if this overlay is to be rendered on snapshot during zoom animation.

        Returns:
        true if this overlay is not to be cleared by NMapOverlayManager.clearOverlays().

      • setHidden

        public void setHidden(boolean hidden)
        Show or hide the overlay
        Parameters:
        hidden - set true to hide this overlay, otherwise false. default is false.

      • onSizeChanged

        protected void onSizeChanged(int width,

      • draw

        public void draw(android.graphics.Canvas canvas,
                 NMapView mapView,
                 boolean shadow)
        Draw the overlay over the map. This will be called on all active overlays with shadow=true, to lay down the shadow layer, and then again on all overlays with shadow=false. By default, draws nothing.
        Parameters:
        canvas - The Canvas upon which to draw. Note that this may already have a transformation applied, so be sure to leave it the way you found it.
        mapView - the MapView that requested the draw. Use NMapView.getMapProjection() to convert between on-screen pixels and latitude/longitude pairs.
        shadow - If true, draw the shadow layer. If false, draw the overlay contents.

      • drawFocusedItem

        public void drawFocusedItem(android.graphics.Canvas canvas,
                            NMapView mapView,
                            boolean shadow)
        Draw the focused item on the overlay over the map.
        Parameters:
        canvas - The Canvas upon which to draw. Note that this may already have a transformation applied, so be sure to leave it the way you found it.
        mapView - the MapView that requested the draw. Use NMapView.getMapProjection() to convert between on-screen pixels and latitude/longitude pairs.
        shadow - If true, draw the shadow layer. If false, draw the overlay contents.

      • draw

        public boolean draw(android.graphics.Canvas canvas,
                    NMapView mapView,
                    boolean shadow,
                    long when)
        Draw call for animated overlays. By default, calls through to draw(Canvas, MapView, boolean) and returns false.
        Parameters:
        canvas - The Canvas upon which to draw. Note that this may already have a transformation applied, so be sure to leave it the way you found it.
        mapView - the MapView that requested the draw. Use NMapView.getMapProjection() to convert between on-screen pixels and latitude/longitude pairs.
        shadow - If true, draw the shadow layer. If false, draw the overlay contents.
        when - The time-stamp of the draw.
        Returns:
        true if you need to be drawn again right away; false otherwise. Default implementation returns false.

      • drawAt

        public static void drawAt(android.graphics.Canvas canvas,
                          android.graphics.drawable.Drawable drawable,
                          int px,
                          int py,
                          boolean shadow)
        Convenience method to draw a Drawable at an offset. px and py are pixel coordinates. You can find appropriate coordinates from latitude/longitude using the NMapView.getProjection() method on the NMapView passed to you in draw(Canvas, MapView, boolean).

      • onKeyDown

        public boolean onKeyDown(int keyCode,
                         android.view.KeyEvent event,
                         NMapView mapView)
        Handle a key down event. By default does nothing and returns false.
        Returns:
        true if the tap was handled by this overlay.

      • onKeyUp

        public boolean onKeyUp(int keyCode,
                       android.view.KeyEvent event,
                       NMapView mapView)
        Handle a key up event. By default does nothing and returns false.
        Returns:
        true if the tap was handled by this overlay.

      • onTap

        public boolean onTap(int px,
                     int py,
                     NMapView mapView)
        Override this method to handle a "tap" on an item. This could be from a touch-screen tap on an on-screen Item, or from a track-ball click on a centered, selected Item. By default, does nothing and returns false.
        Returns:
        true if the tap was handled by this overlay.

      • onTouchEvent

        public boolean onTouchEvent(android.view.MotionEvent ev,
                            NMapView mapView)
        Handle a touch event. By default does nothing and returns false.
        Returns:
        true if the tap was handled by this overlay.

      • onTrackballEvent

        public boolean onTrackballEvent(android.view.MotionEvent event,
                                NMapView mapView)
        Handle a trackball event. By default does nothing and returns false.
        Returns:
        true if the tap was handled by this overlay.
